00001 #ifndef _physworld_cpp
00002 #define _physworld_cpp
00003 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00004 //The world that integrates everything
00005 //
00006 //This is where all the calls to the the underlying libraries should be from.
00007 //PhysWorld is an abstraction layer to all of the non-ui libraries. The ui
00008 //layers wx and ogre both have their own main loops, so it is almost mandatory
00009 //for other code to interact with those libraries directly.
00010 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

00031 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00032 // Physworld constructor
00033 //this should create the basic objects for stroing and tracking the roots of
00034 //objects in the game
00035 PhysWorld::PhysWorld()
00036 {
00037         this->Construct(
00038                 new PhysVector3(-100.0,-100.0,-100.0),
00039                 new PhysVector3(100.0, 100.0, 100.0),
00040                 10
00041                 );
00042 }
00043 
00044 PhysWorld::PhysWorld(PhysVector3* GeographyLowerBounds_, PhysVector3* GeographyUpperbounds_, unsigned short int  MaxPhysicsProxies_)
00045 {
00046         this->Construct(GeographyLowerBounds_, GeographyUpperbounds_, MaxPhysicsProxies_);
00047 }
00048 
00049 void PhysWorld::Construct(PhysVector3* GeographyLowerBounds_, PhysVector3* GeographyUpperbounds_, unsigned short int  MaxPhysicsProxies_)
00050 {
00051         PlayerSettings = new Settings();
00052 
00053         //We create our Ogre environment
00054         this->OgreRoot = new Ogre::Root(GetPluginsDotCFG(),GetSettingsDotCFG(),"Physgame.log");
00055         //Ogre resource related code
00056         /// @todo : From here to the callbacks should probably be moved to another file
00057         //this->OgreRoot->addResourceLocation(GetDataDirectory(), "FileSystem", Ogre::ResourceGroupManager::DEFAULT_RESOURCE_GROUP_NAME, false);
00058     this->OgreRoot->addResourceLocation(GetDataDirectory(), "FileSystem", "Robot", false);
00059     this->OgreResource = Ogre::ResourceGroupManager::getSingletonPtr();
00060     this->OgreResource->declareResource("robot.mesh", "Mesh", "Robot");
00061     //this->OgreResource->declareResource("robot.skeleton", "Skeleton", "Robot");
00062     this->OgreResource->declareResource("Examples.material", "Material", "Robot");
00063     //this->OgreResource->declareResource("r2skin.jpg", "Texture", "Robot");
00064     //this->OgreResource->initialiseResourceGroup("Robot");
00065 
00066     TestLogger();
00067 
00068     //Callbacks are the main way that a game using the PhysWorld will be able to have their code run at custom times
00069         this->CallBacks = new PhysWorldCallBackManager(this);
00070 
00071     //Events are the main way for the game using the physworld to  get information about the various subsystems
00072     this->Events = new PhysEventManager;
00073 
00074         //instantiate the Physics engine and related items
00075         GeographyLowerBounds = GeographyLowerBounds_;
00076         GeographyUpperbounds = GeographyUpperbounds_;
00077         MaxPhysicsProxies = MaxPhysicsProxies_;
00078 
00079         btVector3 worldAabbMin(GeographyLowerBounds->X, GeographyLowerBounds->Y, GeographyLowerBounds->Z);
00080         btVector3 worldAabbMax(GeographyUpperbounds->X, GeographyUpperbounds->Y, GeographyUpperbounds->Z);
00081 
00082         this->BulletBroadphase = new btAxisSweep3(worldAabbMin, worldAabbMax, MaxPhysicsProxies);
00083         this->BulletSolver = new btSequentialImpulseConstraintSolver;
00084         this->BulletCollisionConfiguration = new btDefaultCollisionConfiguration();
00085         this->BulletDispatcher = new btCollisionDispatcher(BulletCollisionConfiguration);
00086 
00087         this->BulletDynamicsWorld = new btSoftRigidDynamicsWorld(
00088                                                                                                 BulletDispatcher,
00089                                                                                                 BulletBroadphase,
00090                                                                                                 BulletSolver,
00091                                                                                                 BulletCollisionConfiguration);
00092 }

00094 void PhysWorld::TestLogger()
00095 {
00096     string temp0("0");
00097     char temp1 = 'a';
00098     short int temp2 = 2;
00099     int temp3 = 3;
00100     long int temp4 = 4;
00101     unsigned short int temp5 = 5;
00102     unsigned int temp6 = 6;
00103     unsigned long int temp7 = 7;
00104     bool temp8 = true;
00105     float temp9 = 0.9;
00106     double temp10 = 9.9999;
00107     long double temp11 = 11.00011;
00108     wchar_t temp12 = 'L';
00109     size_t temp13 = 13;
00110     PhysReal temp14 = 1.4;
00111     PhysWhole temp15 = 15;
00112     PhysString temp16("16 or so");
00113     PhysVector3 temp17(0,1,7);
00114     //dynamic_cast<PhysEvent*>// Add physevent as something that can be logged.
00115     //TODO add each type of event here to make it really wasy to log events
00116 
00117     OneLogTest(temp0, "string");
00118     OneLogTest(temp1, "char");
00119     OneLogTest(temp2, "short int");
00120     OneLogTest(temp3, "int");
00121     OneLogTest(temp4, "long int");
00122     OneLogTest(temp5, "unsigned short int");
00123     OneLogTest(temp6, "unsigned int");
00124     OneLogTest(temp7, "unsigned long int");
00125     OneLogTest(temp8, "bool");
00126     OneLogTest(temp9, "float");
00127     OneLogTest(temp10, "double");
00128     OneLogTest(temp11, "long double");
00129     OneLogTest(temp12, "wchar_t");
00130     OneLogTest(temp13, "size_t");
00131     OneLogTest(temp14, "PhysReal");
00132     OneLogTest(temp15, "PhysWhole");
00133     OneLogTest(temp16, "PhysString");
00134     OneLogTest(temp17, "PhysVector3");
00135 }
00136 
00137 template <class T> void PhysWorld::OneLogTest(T Data, string DataType, string Message1, string Message2)
00138 {
00139     try
00140     {
00141         Log(Message1+DataType);
00142         LogAndThrow(Data);
00143     } catch (T excepted) {
00144         Log(Message2+DataType);
00145         Log(excepted);
00146     }
00147 }
00148 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00149 //tears the world down
00150 PhysWorld::~PhysWorld()
00151 {
00152         //Destroy the physical world that we loved and cherished
00153         //dWorldDestroy(this->OdeWorld);
00154         delete GeographyLowerBounds;
00155         delete GeographyUpperbounds;
00156         delete BulletBroadphase;
00157         delete BulletCollisionConfiguration;
00158         delete BulletDispatcher;
00159         delete BulletSolver;
00160         delete BulletDynamicsWorld;
00161 
00162         //All the pointers Ogre made should get taken care of by OGRE
00163         delete OgreRoot;
00164 
00165         //clear up our objects
00166         delete CallBacks;
00167         delete Events;
00168 
00169 
00170         delete PlayerSettings;
00171 
00172         SDL_FreeSurface(SDLscreen);
00173 
00174         //remove sdl stuff
00175         void SDL_Quit(void);
00176 }

00178 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00179 //appends to the gamelog which is managed by Ogre
00180 template <class T> void PhysWorld::Log(T Message)
00181 {
00182         stringstream temp;
00183         temp << Message;
00184         Ogre::LogManager::getSingleton().logMessage(temp.str());
00185 }
00186 
00187 template <class T> void PhysWorld::LogAndThrow(T Message)
00188 {
00189         this->Log(Message);
00190         throw(Message);
00191 }

00193 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00194 //Shows the ogre settings Dialog, and allows it to save settings to ogres
00195 //preset save location
00196 bool PhysWorld::ShowSystemSettingDialog()
00197 {
00198         try
00199         {
00200                 return this->OgreRoot->showConfigDialog();
00201         } catch (exception& e) {
00202                 this->Log("Ogre settings windows from main UI or mandatory setting failure");
00203                 this->Log(e.what());
00204                 return false;
00205         }
00206 }

00208 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00209 // Start the Game already
00210 void PhysWorld::GameInit()
00211 {
00212         //try to load the ogre config
00213         this->LoadOgreSettings();
00214 
00215         this->CreateRenderWindow();
00216 
00217     //Create a the RenderTimer, which will be used to measure the time
00218     Ogre::Timer RenderTimer;
00219 
00220         bool Callbackbools[] = {true, true, true, true};
00221 
00222         //Used for tracking times to prevent Infinite render loops in graphically simple games
00223         //PhysWhole Times[] = {0,0,0,0};
00224 
00225         //TODO finish test code
00226         this->OgreResource->initialiseResourceGroup("Robot");
00227         this->OgreSceneManager->setAmbientLight( Ogre::ColourValue( 1, 1, 1 ) );
00228         Ogre::Entity *ent1 = this->OgreSceneManager->createEntity( "Robot", "robot.mesh" );
00229         Ogre::SceneNode *node1 = this->OgreSceneManager->getRootSceneNode()->createChildSceneNode( "RobotNode" );
00230         node1->attachObject( ent1 );
00231 
00232     PhysWhole FrameDelay = 0;
00233     PhysWhole FrameTime = 0;
00234 
00235     /// @page MainLoop
00236     /// The MainLoop does stuffs that needs to be documented
00237     /// @todo actually document the gameloop
00238         /// The Main loop begins in PhysGame.GameInit(). Once started it runs the callbacks present in the callback manager until one of them
00239         /// Returns false. It has a pretty specific work flow
00240         //As long as all the CallBacks return true the game continues
00241         while (Callbackbools[0] && Callbackbools[1] && Callbackbools[2] && Callbackbools[3])
00242         {
00243         //To prepare each callback we add an event to the event manager which includes the time since th last frame render ended
00244         //However we will only do this if a callback is set
00245         if(this->CallBacks->IsPreInputCallbackSet())
00246         {
00247                         this->Events->AddEvent(new PhysEventRenderTime(FrameTime));
00248                         Callbackbools[0] = this->CallBacks->PreInput();
00249                         this->DoMainLoopInputBuffering();
00250         }
00251 
00252                 if(this->CallBacks->IsPrePhysicsCallbackSet())
00253         {
00254             this->Events->AddEvent(new PhysEventRenderTime(FrameTime));
00255                         Callbackbools[1] = this->CallBacks->PrePhysics();
00256                         this->DoMainLoopPhysics();
00257         }
00258 
00259                 if(this->CallBacks->IsPreRenderCallbackSet())
00260         {
00261             this->Events->AddEvent(new PhysEventRenderTime(FrameTime));
00262                         Callbackbools[2] = this->CallBacks->PreRender();
00263         }
00264 
00265                 //Render the frame and figure the amount of time it took //Limit frame rate to 62.5
00266                 this->DoMainLoopRender();
00267                 FrameTime = RenderTimer.getMilliseconds();
00268                 RenderTimer.reset();
00269                 if(16>FrameTime){                               //use 16666 for microseconds
00270                     FrameDelay++;
00271                         WaitMilliseconds( FrameDelay );
00272                 }else if(16==FrameTime){
00273         }else{
00274             if (0<FrameDelay){
00275                 FrameDelay--;
00276             }else{
00277                 FrameDelay=0;
00278             }
00279         }
00280 
00281                 if(this->CallBacks->IsPostRenderCallbackSet())
00282         {
00283                         this->Events->AddEvent(new PhysEventRenderTime(FrameTime));
00284                         Callbackbools[3] = this->CallBacks->PostRender();
00285         }
00286 
00287         }//End of main loop
00288 
00289         //Some after loop cleanup
00290         this->DestroyRenderWindow();
00291 }

00293 void PhysWorld::MoveCamera(PhysVector3 Position, PhysVector3 LookAt)
00294 {
00295         this->OgreCamera->setPosition(Ogre::Vector3(Position.X,Position.Y,Position.Z));
00296     this->OgreCamera->lookAt(Ogre::Vector3(LookAt.X,LookAt.Y,LookAt.Z));
00297 }

00299 void PhysWorld::DoMainLoopAllItems()
00300 {
00301         this->DoMainLoopPhysics();
00302         this->DoMainLoopWindowManagerBuffering();
00303         this->DoMainLoopInputBuffering();
00304         this->DoMainLoopRender();
00305 }

00316     Log("WM EventCount Pending:");

00318     //TODO: make Physevents for each of the events in SDL_W1111mEvents(and delete the SDL events)

00321 void PhysWorld::DoMainLoopInputBuffering()
00322 {
00323     this->PreProcessSDLEvents();
00324     Log("User Input EventCount Pending:");
00325     Log(SDL_UserInputEvents.size());
00326 
00327     PhysEventUserInput FromSDLEvents;
00328 
00329     //TODO: make Physevents for each of the events in SDL_WmEvents(and delete the SDL events)
00330     //RawEvent QueueEvent;
00331     while( !SDL_UserInputEvents.empty() )
00332     {
00333         SDL_Event * CurrentEvent = SDL_UserInputEvents.front();
00334         this->Log(GetNameOfEventFrom(*CurrentEvent));
00335 
00336         SDL_UserInputEvents.pop();
00337     }//*/

00352 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00353 //Loads the Ogre Configuration
00354 void PhysWorld::LoadOgreSettings()
00355 {
00356         //Try loading from the default location
00357         if (!this->OgreRoot->restoreConfig())
00358     {
00359         //if we can't do that then lets make new settings
00360         if (!this->ShowSystemSettingDialog())
00361         {
00362                 this->LogAndThrow("Error 1: Could not setup Ogre.");
00363                 }
00364     }
00365 
00366 }

00368 //Seriously read the Function Name
00369 void PhysWorld::CreateRenderWindow()
00370 {
00371         //Get what is needed for SDL started
00372         if (SDL_Init(SDL_INIT_VIDEO) < 0) {
00373                 this->Log("Error 2: Unable to init SDL, SDL Error Follows:");
00374                 this->LogAndThrow(SDL_GetError());
00375         }
00376 
00377         //Setup the SDL render window
00378         this->SDLscreen = SDL_SetVideoMode(PlayerSettings->getRenderHeight(), PlayerSettings->getRenderWidth(), 0, SDL_OPENGL);
00379     SDL_WM_SetCaption("Catch!", NULL);
00380 
00381         //Start Ogre Without a native render window
00382         this->OgreGameWindow = this->OgreRoot->initialise(false, "physgame");
00383 
00384         //Configure Ogre to render to the SDL window
00385         Ogre::NameValuePairList *misc;
00386         misc=(Ogre::NameValuePairList*) GetSDLOgreBinder();
00387         (*misc)["title"] = Ogre::String("Catch!");
00388         this->OgreGameWindow = this->OgreRoot->createRenderWindow("physgame", PlayerSettings->getRenderHeight(), PlayerSettings->getRenderWidth(), PlayerSettings->getFullscreen(), misc);
00389     //Added following lines to attempt to make the render window visable
00390     //this->OgreGameWindow->setVisible(true);
00391         //this->OgreGameWindow->setActive(true);
00392     //this->OgreGameWindow->setAutoUpdated(true);
00393 
00394         //prepare a scenemanager
00395         this->OgreSceneManager = this->OgreRoot->createSceneManager(Ogre::ST_GENERIC,"SceneManager");
00396 
00397         //setup a default camera
00398         this->OgreCamera = this->OgreSceneManager->createCamera("Camera");
00399         this->OgreCamera->setNearClipDistance(5.0f);
00400     this->OgreCamera->setFarClipDistance(5000.0f);
00401 
00402         this->MoveCamera(PhysVector3(0.0f,0.0f,500.0f), PhysVector3(0.0f,0.0f,0.0f));
00403 
00404         //viewport connects camera and render window
00405         this->OgreViewport = this->OgreGameWindow->addViewport(OgreCamera);
00406 
00407         //setting the aspect ratio must be done after we setup the viewport
00408         this->OgreCamera->setAspectRatio( Ogre::Real(OgreViewport->getActualWidth()) / Ogre::Real(OgreViewport->getActualHeight()) );
00409 }
00410 
00411 void PhysWorld::DestroyRenderWindow()
00412 {
00413     this->OgreGameWindow->destroy();
00414 }

00416 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00417 // Deals with SDL
00418 
00419 
00420 //This function will get all the events from SDL and Sort them into one of two Queues
00421 void PhysWorld::PreProcessSDLEvents()
00422 {
00423 
00424     RawEvent FromSDL;
00425         while(SDL_PollEvent(&FromSDL))
00426         {
00427         switch(FromSDL.type)
00428         {
00429             case SDL_ACTIVEEVENT:   //when the window gains focus
00430             case SDL_VIDEORESIZE:   //when the screen is resized
00431             case SDL_VIDEOEXPOSE:   //when the windows goes from being hidden to being shown
00432             case SDL_QUIT:          //when SDL closes
00433             case SDL_SYSWMEVENT:
00434                 SDL_WmEvents.push(&FromSDL);
00435                 break;
00436             case SDL_KEYDOWN:
00437                 exit(EXIT_SUCCESS); //remove this as soon as we get the X working
00438             case SDL_KEYUP:
00439             case SDL_MOUSEMOTION:
00440             case SDL_MOUSEBUTTONDOWN:
00441             case SDL_MOUSEBUTTONUP:
00442             case SDL_JOYAXISMOTION:
00443             case SDL_JOYBUTTONDOWN:
00444             case SDL_JOYBUTTONUP:
00445             case SDL_JOYBALLMOTION:
00446             case SDL_JOYHATMOTION:
00447                 SDL_UserInputEvents.push(&FromSDL);
00448                 break;
00449             case SDL_USEREVENT://Never thrown by SDL, but could be added by a user
00450             default:
00451                 throw ("Unknown SDL Event Inserted");
00452                 break;
00453         }
00454         }
00455 }
